definition: Not quite right; inappropriate or out of place; wrongly or inappropriately.
mnemonic: Amiss sounds like 'a-miss,' as in something missed the mark or is not right.
visual_representation: Picture a clock that is slightly off time, symbolizing something amiss.
example_sentence: She could tell something was amiss when her friend didn't show up for their meeting.

definition: A sharp projection near the end of an arrow, fishhook, or similar item, angled away from the main point so as to make extraction difficult; a deliberately hurtful remark.
mnemonic: Barb sounds like 'sharp,' indicating something that can hurt or cause injury, like a sharp comment or a fishhook.
visual_representation: Picture a fishhook with a sharp, backward-facing point, symbolizing a barb.
example_sentence: His comment was full of barbs meant to sting and offend.

definition: To invent or devise (a new word or phrase); a flat, typically round piece of metal with an official stamp, used as money.
mnemonic: Coin sounds like 'coin-phrase,' as in coming up with a new phrase or word.
visual_representation: Picture someone creating a new word or phrase and stamping it like a coin, symbolizing coining a term.
example_sentence: The company coined the term 'eco-friendly' to describe its products.

definition: To take (a machine or structure) to pieces; to disassemble.
mnemonic: Dismantle sounds like 'dis-man-tle,' as in taking apart something that was put together by man.
visual_representation: Picture a mechanic taking apart a car engine, symbolizing dismantling.
example_sentence: The workers began to dismantle the old factory machinery.

mnemonic: Execrable sounds like 'exe-crable,' as in something so bad that it should be exiled or cursed.
visual_representation: Picture a dish that tastes so bad it makes someone grimace, symbolizing execrable.
example_sentence: The food at the restaurant was execrable; we couldn't finish our meals.

definition: (Adjective) Fierce, cruel, or terrible; (Verb) To knock down, strike down, or cut down (especially a tree).
mnemonic: Fell sounds like 'fell-tree,' as in cutting down something or being deadly and fierce.
visual_representation: Picture a lumberjack cutting down a large tree, symbolizing felling.
example_sentence: The storm was so fell that it felled trees all over the city.

definition: Social superiority as demonstrated by genteel manners, behavior, or appearances.
mnemonic: Gentility sounds like 'gentle-ity,' as in showing gentle and refined behavior.
visual_representation: Picture someone with refined manners, dressed elegantly and acting with grace, symbolizing gentility.
example_sentence: Her gentility and poise made her the perfect host for the gala.

definition: A person who does not believe in religion or who adheres to a religion other than one's own.
mnemonic: Infidel sounds like 'in-faith-del,' as in someone who is not within the faith.
visual_representation: Picture someone being labeled an outsider by a religious group, symbolizing an infidel.
example_sentence: In the eyes of the devout community, he was considered an infidel.

definition: A series of petitions for use in church services or processions, usually recited by the clergy and responded to by the people; a tedious recital or repetitive series.
hindi_meaning: दीर्घ सूची, एक ही बात की पुनरावृत्ति
mnemonic: Litany sounds like 'list-any,' as in a long list of items or repeated phrases.
visual_representation: Picture someone reading a long, repetitive list during a ceremony, symbolizing a litany.
example_sentence: She recited a litany of complaints about her day.

definition: (Verb) To be absorbed in thought; to ponder; (Noun) A source of inspiration, especially for a creative artist.
hindi_meaning: विचार करना, ध्यान मग्न होना; प्रेरणा स्रोत
mnemonic: Muse sounds like 'muse-ic,' as in music that inspires or makes one think deeply.
visual_representation: Picture a writer staring thoughtfully at a blank page, drawing inspiration from a muse.
example_sentence: The artist found his muse in the beauty of nature.

definition: A piece of legislation enacted by a municipal authority; an authoritative order or decree.
mnemonic: Ordinance sounds like 'order-nance,' indicating an official order or rule.
visual_representation: Picture a city council passing a new law or rule, symbolizing an ordinance.
example_sentence: The city passed an ordinance requiring all dogs to be kept on leashes in public areas.

definition: A medical professional specializing in the treatment of the feet and their ailments.
mnemonic: Podiatrist sounds like 'pod-iatrist,' with 'pod' relating to feet, indicating a foot doctor.
visual_representation: Picture a doctor examining a patient’s foot, symbolizing a podiatrist.
example_sentence: She visited the podiatrist to treat her recurring foot pain.

definition: To draw back or withdraw (a statement or accusation) as untrue or unjustified; to pull back something in or back.
mnemonic: Retract sounds like 're-track,' as in pulling back or reversing something.
visual_representation: Picture someone pulling back their hand after offering it, symbolizing retraction.
example_sentence: He had to retract his statement after realizing it was incorrect.

definition: (Noun) A supreme ruler, especially a monarch; (Adjective) Possessing supreme or ultimate power.
mnemonic: Sovereign sounds like 'so-reign,' as in someone who reigns supreme.
visual_representation: Picture a king wearing a crown, symbolizing sovereignty.
example_sentence: The country is a sovereign nation, governing itself without outside interference.

definition: (Of a person or animal) easy to control or influence; (Of a situation or problem) easy to deal with.
mnemonic: Tractable sounds like 'track-table,' as in easy to track or guide.
visual_representation: Picture a well-trained dog following commands easily, symbolizing tractability.
example_sentence: The horse was surprisingly tractable for a wild animal.

definition: Behavior showing high moral standards; a good or useful quality.
mnemonic: Virtue sounds like 'vir-tue,' as in being true to virtuous and moral behavior.
visual_representation: Picture a person helping someone in need, symbolizing virtue.
example_sentence: Patience is a virtue often overlooked in today’s fast-paced world.
